elements.title: Signatures of Fractional Quantum Anomalous Hall States in Twisted MoTe2 (Nature - research articles)
elements.contents:
Signatures of Fractional Quantum Anomalous Hall States in Twisted MoTe2

  • Jiaqi Cai
  • Eric Anderson
  • Xiaodong Xu
Article14 Jun 2023

elements.title: Single-photon absorption and emission from a natural photosynthetic complex (Nature - research articles)
elements.contents:
Single-photon absorption and emission from a natural photosynthetic complex

Using a heralded single-photon source along with coincidence counting, we establish time correlation functions for B800 excitation and B850 fluorescence emission and demonstrate that both events involve single photons.

  • Quanwei Li
  • Kaydren Orcutt
  • K. Birgitta Whaley
ArticleOpen Access14 Jun 2023

elements.title: General cross-coupling reactions with adaptive dynamic homogeneous catalysis (Nature - research articles)
elements.contents:
General cross-coupling reactions with adaptive dynamic homogeneous catalysis

A self-adjustive catalytic system with nickel under visible-light-driven redox reaction conditions provides a general method for carbon–(hetero)atom cross-coupling reactions and is demonstrated for nine different bond-forming reactions.

  • Indrajit Ghosh
  • Nikita Shlapakov
  • Burkhard König
Article14 Jun 2023

elements.title: Non-orientable order and non-commutative response in frustrated metamaterials (Nature - research articles)
elements.contents:
Non-orientable order and non-commutative response in frustrated metamaterials

We describe globally frustrated matter as deformations of non-orientable surfaces, with the concept of non-orientable order we demonstrate topologically protected mechanical memories, suggesting a design principle for effectively storing information in frustrated metamaterials.

  • Xiaofei Guo
  • Marcelo Guzmán
  • Corentin Coulais
Article14 Jun 2023

elements.title: Krill body size drives particulate organic carbon export in West Antarctica (Nature - research articles)
elements.contents:
Krill body size drives particulate organic carbon export in West Antarctica

A multi-decadal sediment-trap time series reveals that the body size, not the abundance, of Antarctic krill drives the particulate organic carbon flux on the continental shelf of the West Antarctic Peninsula.

  • Rebecca Trinh
  • Hugh W. Ducklow
  • William R. Fraser
Article14 Jun 2023

elements.title: A pangenome reference of 36 Chinese populations (Nature - research articles)
elements.contents:
A pangenome reference of 36 Chinese populations

A study reports data from the first phase of the Chinese Pangenome Consortium including 116 de novo assemblies from 58 core samples representing 36 minority Chinese ethnic groups.

  • Yang Gao
  • Xiaofei Yang
  • Shuhua Xu
ArticleOpen Access14 Jun 2023

elements.title: Excitonic topological order in imbalanced electron–hole bilayers (Nature - research articles)
elements.contents:
Excitonic topological order in imbalanced electron–hole bilayers

This study reports an excitonic topological order emerging in imbalanced electron–hole bilayers.

  • Rui Wang
  • Tigran A. Sedrakyan
  • Rui-Rui Du
Article14 Jun 2023

elements.title: A tripartite rheostat controls self-regulated host plant resistance to insects (Nature - research articles)
elements.contents:
A tripartite rheostat controls self-regulated host plant resistance to insects

Insect salivary protein (BISP) targets OsRLCK185 to suppress defence in susceptible plants, whereas in resistant plants BISP binds BPH14 to activate host plant resistance. To restore cellular homeostasis, the resistance mechanism is fine-tuned by selective autophagy.

  • Jianping Guo
  • Huiying Wang
  • Guangcun He
ArticleOpen Access14 Jun 2023

elements.title: Psychedelics reopen the social reward learning critical period (Nature - research articles)
elements.contents:
Psychedelics reopen the social reward learning critical period

Behavioural electrophysiological and transcriptomic studies in mice show that psychedelic drugs reopen the social reward learning critical period and suggest that this involves reorganization of the extracellular matrix.

  • Romain Nardou
  • Edward Sawyer
  • Gül Dölen
ArticleOpen Access14 Jun 2023

elements.title: Evidence for the utility of quantum computing before fault tolerance (Nature - research articles)
elements.contents:
Evidence for the utility of quantum computing before fault tolerance

Experiments on a noisy 127-qubit superconducting quantum processor report the accurate measurement of expectation values beyond the reach of current brute-force classical computation, demonstrating evidence for the utility of quantum computing before fault tolerance.

  • Youngseok Kim
  • Andrew Eddins
  • Abhinav Kandala
ArticleOpen Access14 Jun 2023

elements.title: Spin state and deep interior structure of Mars from InSight radio tracking (Nature - research articles)
elements.contents:
Spin state and deep interior structure of Mars from InSight radio tracking

Analysis of radio science data from the NASA InSight Mars lander reveals details of the rotation of the planet, which have been used to determine fundamental information about its core, mantle and atmosphere.

  • Sébastien Le Maistre
  • Attilio Rivoldini
  • W. Bruce Banerdt
Article14 Jun 2023

elements.title: Mitotic tethering enables inheritance of shattered micronuclear chromosomes (Nature - research articles)
elements.contents:
Mitotic tethering enables inheritance of shattered micronuclear chromosomes

Chromothriptically produced pieces of a micronucleated chromosome are shown to be tethered together in mitosis by a protein complex consisting of MDC1, TOPBP1 and CIP2A, thus enabling their inheritance by a single daughter cell.

  • Prasad Trivedi
  • Christopher D. Steele
  • Don W. Cleveland
Article14 Jun 2023

elements.title: Detection of phosphates originating from Enceladus’s ocean (Nature - research articles)
elements.contents:
Detection of phosphates originating from Enceladus’s ocean

Cassini’s Cosmic Dust Analyzer mass spectra of ice grains emitted by Enceladus show the presence of sodium phosphates, suggesting that phosphorus is readily available in Enceladus’s ocean in the form of orthophosphates.

  • Frank Postberg
  • Yasuhito Sekine
  • Shuya Tan
ArticleOpen Access14 Jun 2023

elements.title: Vanadium oxide and a sharp onset of cold-trapping on a giant exoplanet (Nature - research articles)
elements.contents:
Vanadium oxide and a sharp onset of cold-trapping on a giant exoplanet

Analysis of transits of an ultra-hot giant exoplanet reports the precise abundance constraints of 14 major refractory elements, showing distinct deviations from proto-solar, along with a sharp transition temperature at which those elements are depleted.

  • Stefan Pelletier
  • Björn Benneke
  • Julian Stürmer
Article14 Jun 2023

elements.title: Inference and reconstruction of the heimdallarchaeial ancestry of eukaryotes (Nature - research articles)
elements.contents:
Inference and reconstruction of the heimdallarchaeial ancestry of eukaryotes

Analyses of multiple phylogenetic marker datasets of Asgard archaea provide insight into the transition from prokaryotes to eukaryotes, specifically placing eukaryotes within Asgard archaea and as a sister lineage to Hodarchaeales.

  • Laura Eme
  • Daniel Tamarit
  • Thijs J. G. Ettema
ArticleOpen Access14 Jun 2023

elements.title: Genome editing of a rice CDP-DAG synthase confers multipathogen resistance (Nature - research articles)
elements.contents:
Genome editing of a rice CDP-DAG synthase confers multipathogen resistance

Editing of a rice gene that has a role in phospholipid synthesis has endowed rice plants with broad-spectrum resistance to disease, including protection from common bacterial and fungal pathogens, without decreasing the yield.

  • Gan Sha
  • Peng Sun
  • Guotian Li
Article14 Jun 2023

elements.title: Liquid metal for high-entropy alloy nanoparticles synthesis (Nature - research articles)
elements.contents:
Liquid metal for high-entropy alloy nanoparticles synthesis

We discovered that liquid metal endowing negative mixing enthalpy with other elements could provide a stable thermodynamic condition and act as a desirable dynamic mixing reservoir, realizing the synthesis of high-entropy alloy nanoparticles.

  • Guanghui Cao
  • Jingjing Liang
  • Lei Fu
Article14 Jun 2023

elements.title: High-brightness scalable continuous-wave single-mode photonic-crystal laser (Nature - research articles)
elements.contents:
High-brightness scalable continuous-wave single-mode photonic-crystal laser

We developed large-scale photonic-crystal surface-emitting lasers with controlled Hermitian and non-Hermitian couplings inside the photonic crystal and a pre-installed spatial distribution of the lattice constant, which leads to the realization of a continuous-wave brightness of 1 GW cm−2 sr−1.

  • Masahiro Yoshida
  • Shumpei Katsuno
  • Susumu Noda
ArticleOpen Access14 Jun 2023

elements.title: Break-induced replication orchestrates resection-dependent template switching (Nature - research articles)
elements.contents:
Break-induced replication orchestrates resection-dependent template switching

Break-induced telomere synthesis initiates recruitment of the SNM1A nuclease, which promotes DNA end resection that in turn allows template switching to enable bypass of lesions.

  • Tianpeng Zhang
  • Yashpal Rawal
  • Roger A. Greenberg
Article14 Jun 2023

elements.title: Genetic stabilization of attenuated oral vaccines against poliovirus types 1 and 3 (Nature - research articles)
elements.contents:
Genetic stabilization of attenuated oral vaccines against poliovirus types 1 and 3

Mouse experiments and deep sequencing confirmed that two additional live attenuated vaccine candidates against type 1 and 3 polioviruses remained attenuated and preserved all documented nOPV2 characteristics concerning genetic stability following accelerated virus evolution.

  • Ming Te Yeh
  • Matthew Smith
  • Andrew Macadam
ArticleOpen Access14 Jun 2023
